titles.title: To designate the Federal building located at 100 Alabama Street NW, in Atlanta, Georgia, as the "Sam Nunn Federal Center".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 105-232.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 86.

action.text: Mr. Kim moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Laid on the table. See S. 347 for further action.

bill.summary: 3/3/1998--Passed House amended. Designates the Federal building located at 61 Forsyth Street, SW., in Atlanta, Georgia, as the Sam Nunn Atlanta Federal Center.
